result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kinte K Scott

records.addlTxt: 8:45 AM Defendant Kinte K Scott in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Kinte K Scott.  Attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense files a bond motion.  Defense makes further argument.  The proposed co-signer is present in court today.  State objects. BTC: Defendant is a high risk, bond modification denied.  Trial dates remain.
Bail/bond hearing on October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:43 AM Defendant Kinte K Scott in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Kinte K Scott.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  There has been a global offer made.  Parties do not agree.  BTC: Jury trials set on both cases. All Motions in Limine, Witness lists, Proposed Jury Instructions and changes to the Substantive Jury Instructions are due 48  hours before the Final Pretrial.  Parties are to check for witness availability for this scheduled trial date and inform the Court of any problems.
Jury trial scheduled for February 28, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Emailed dispatch at 2:15 pm

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:04 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kinte K Scott appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared by video for Kinte K Scott. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant, Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Return on warrant/Initial appearance on April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
